metadata.title: CVE-2020-21688 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-use-after-free in the av_freep function in libavutil/mem.c of FFmpeg4.2 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libav-tools - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.17-0ubuntu0.1+esm2').
vice package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
